sentences.en: But if early Carter was too trusting, then early Reagan was too truculent.
sentences.cn: 可是,如果说初期的卡特过于相信对手的话, 那么上台不久的里根却过分苛刻挑剔.

sentences.en: Gallagher was truculent as though he knew he were going to be beaten.
sentences.cn: 加拉赫似乎自知败局已定,开口就没好气.

sentences.en: He became very truculent and started arguing with me angrily.
sentences.cn: 他当时盛气凌人,气冲冲地同我吵了起来.

sentences.en: He become very truculent and start argue with me angrily.
sentences.cn: 他当时盛气凌人,气冲冲地同我吵了起来.

sentences.en: He was in no truculent state of mind now.
sentences.cn: 这会儿他心肠一点也不狠毒了.

sentences.en: He was seen as truculent, temperamental, too unwilling to tolerate others.
sentences.cn: 他们认为他为人蛮横无理, 性情暴躁, 不大能容人.

sentences.en: His demagogues, who bear names like Aaron Blue - Skin, are as meanly truculent as Cooper's Anti - Renters.
sentences.cn: 他笔下那些煽风点火的政客,诸如蓝皮艾伦之流, 卑鄙残忍不下于库珀的 抗 租者.

sentences.en: It was his usual aspect, and a truculent one.
sentences.cn: 这是他惯常的模样, 是一种好斗的表情.

sentences.en: She wondered why her son held such a truculent attitude towards his new classmates.
sentences.cn: 她想知道儿子为什么对新同学态度那么尖刻.

sentences.en: The policeman caught something in the tone and looked over with truculent eyes.
sentences.cn: 那个警察也听出他声调里有问题,于是用严厉的目光向这边看.

words.tran_cn: 野蛮；好战；刻薄；致命性（等于truculency）
好斗的；野蛮的；言词刻毒的

trans.tran_cn: 致命的，好斗的，凶狠的，尖刻的
trans.tran_en: bad-tempered and always willing to argue with people
